storyTitle: As HR Officer, I want to add manual attendance entries to achieve complete attendance records

testCases.title: Validate adding manual attendance entry
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
User has permissions to access manual attendance entry features
Attendance system is accessible and operational
At least one employee exists in the system with valid employee ID

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance entry page from the main dashboard or menu
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance form is displayed with fields for employee ID, date, time, and reason. All required field indicators are visible

steps.action: Enter valid employee ID in the employee ID field
steps.expectedResult: Employee ID is accepted and employee name is displayed or validated

steps.action: Select a valid date from the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date is populated in the date field in correct format

steps.action: Enter valid time in the time field (e.g., 09:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted and displayed in correct format

steps.action: Enter a reason for manual entry in the reason field (e.g., 'Missed biometric scan')
steps.expectedResult: Reason text is accepted and displayed in the field

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button
steps.expectedResult: Entry is saved successfully and a confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Manual attendance entry added successfully')

steps.action: Navigate to attendance reports section
steps.expectedResult: Attendance reports page is displayed with search or filter options

steps.action: Search for the newly added manual attendance entry using employee ID and date
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance entry is listed correctly in the report with all entered details (employee ID, date, time, reason) and marked as manual entry

postconditions: Manual attendance entry is saved in the database
Entry is visible in attendance reports
Audit log contains record of the manual entry creation with HR officer details and timestamp

testCases.title: Verify duplicate detection for manual entries
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
User has permissions to access manual attendance entry features
At least one biometric attendance record exists for a specific employee, date, and time
Manual attendance entry page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance entry page
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Enter employee ID that has an existing biometric attendance record
steps.expectedResult: Employee ID is accepted and validated

steps.action: Select the same date as the existing biometric record
steps.expectedResult: Date is populated in the date field

steps.action: Enter the same time as the existing biometric record
steps.expectedResult: Time is populated in the time field

steps.action: Enter a reason and click Submit
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the entry and displays a duplicate warning message (e.g., 'Duplicate attendance record detected. A biometric entry already exists for this employee at this date and time')

steps.action: Modify the time field to a unique time that does not conflict with existing records (e.g., change from 09:00 AM to 09:30 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Updated time is displayed in the time field

steps.action: Click Submit button again
steps.expectedResult: Entry is accepted successfully and confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Manual attendance entry added successfully')

steps.action: Verify the entry appears in attendance records
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance entry is visible with the unique time and marked as manual entry

postconditions: Duplicate entry is prevented and not saved in the database
Valid unique entry is saved successfully
System maintains data integrity by preventing duplicate attendance records

testCases.title: Ensure audit logging of manual attendance changes
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
At least one manual attendance entry exists in the system
User has permissions to edit and delete manual attendance entries
Audit logging system is enabled and operational

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance management page
steps.expectedResult: List of existing manual attendance entries is displayed with options to edit or delete

steps.action: Select an existing manual attendance entry and click Edit button
steps.expectedResult: Edit form is displayed with current attendance details pre-populated

steps.action: Modify the time field to a different valid time
steps.expectedResult: Updated time is displayed in the time field

steps.action: Click Save or Update button
steps.expectedResult: Change is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Manual attendance entry updated successfully')

steps.action: Navigate to audit logs section or access audit trail for the edited entry
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays the edit action with details including: user who made the change, timestamp, old value, new value, and entry ID

steps.action: Return to manual attendance management page and select a manual attendance entry
steps.expectedResult: Entry details are displayed with delete option available

steps.action: Click Delete button and confirm the deletion
steps.expectedResult: Entry is deleted successfully and confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Manual attendance entry deleted successfully')

steps.action: Navigate to audit logs section and search for the deletion record
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays the deletion action with details including: user who deleted the entry, timestamp, deleted entry details, and action type as 'DELETE'

steps.action: Verify that both edit and delete actions are recorded with complete information
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs contain complete records of both edit and delete operations with user details, timestamps, and action details

postconditions: Edited entry reflects updated values in the database
Deleted entry is removed from active attendance records
Audit logs contain complete records of all changes with user and timestamp details
Audit trail is immutable and cannot be modified by users

storyTitle: As HR Officer, I want to edit manual attendance entries to correct errors and maintain accurate records

testCases.title: Validate successful manual attendance entry edit
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
User has permissions to edit manual attendance entries
At least one manual attendance entry exists in the system
Manual attendance management page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance management page from the main dashboard or menu
steps.expectedResult: List of manual attendance entries is displayed with columns showing employee ID, date, time, reason, and action buttons (Edit/Delete)

steps.action: Locate a specific manual attendance entry using search or filter options
steps.expectedResult: Target entry is visible in the list with all current details displayed

steps.action: Click the Edit button or icon for the selected entry
steps.expectedResult: Edit form is displayed with current attendance details pre-populated in all fields (employee ID, date, time, reason)

steps.action: Modify the attendance time field to a different valid time (e.g., change from 09:00 AM to 10:30 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Updated time is displayed in the time field and field is highlighted or marked as modified

steps.action: Optionally modify the reason field to reflect the correction (e.g., 'Corrected entry - actual check-in time')
steps.expectedResult: Updated reason text is displayed in the reason field

steps.action: Click Submit, Save, or Update button
steps.expectedResult: Entry is updated successfully and confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Manual attendance entry updated successfully')

steps.action: Verify the updated entry in the manual attendance list
steps.expectedResult: Entry displays the updated time and reason, and shows last modified timestamp

steps.action: Navigate to attendance reports section
steps.expectedResult: Attendance reports page is displayed

steps.action: Search for the edited entry in the attendance report using employee ID and date
steps.expectedResult: Report displays the updated attendance entry with the new time and reflects changes made within 5 minutes

postconditions: Manual attendance entry is updated in the database with new values
Updated entry is visible in attendance reports within 5 minutes
Audit log contains record of the edit with user details and timestamp
Original entry data is preserved in audit history

testCases.title: Verify prevention of duplicate attendance entries on edit
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
User has permissions to edit manual attendance entries
At least one manual attendance entry exists in the system
At least one biometric attendance record exists for the same employee on the same date but different time
Manual attendance management page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance management page
steps.expectedResult: List of manual attendance entries is displayed with edit options

steps.action: Select a manual attendance entry for an employee who has an existing biometric record on the same date
steps.expectedResult: Entry is selected and details are visible

steps.action: Click Edit button for the selected entry
steps.expectedResult: Edit form is displayed with current attendance details pre-populated

steps.action: Modify the time field to match the exact time of the existing biometric attendance record for the same employee and date
steps.expectedResult: Updated time is displayed in the time field

steps.action: Click Submit or Update button
steps.expectedResult: System rejects the edit and displays a duplicate warning message (e.g., 'Cannot update entry. A biometric attendance record already exists for this employee at this date and time' or 'Duplicate attendance detected')

steps.action: Verify that the entry remains unchanged in the list
steps.expectedResult: Original entry values are preserved and no changes are saved

steps.action: Click Edit button again for the same entry
steps.expectedResult: Edit form is displayed with original values

steps.action: Modify the time field to a unique time that does not conflict with any existing biometric or manual records (e.g., 11:45 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Updated unique time is displayed in the time field

steps.action: Click Submit or Update button
steps.expectedResult: Edit is accepted successfully and confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Manual attendance entry updated successfully')

steps.action: Verify the updated entry appears in the list with the new unique time
steps.expectedResult: Entry is displayed with the updated time and no duplicate conflicts exist

postconditions: Duplicate edit is prevented and original entry remains unchanged
Valid unique edit is saved successfully in the database
System maintains data integrity by preventing duplicate attendance records
No conflicting attendance records exist for the same employee, date, and time

testCases.title: Ensure audit logging of manual attendance edits
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
User has permissions to edit manual attendance entries
At least one manual attendance entry exists in the system
Audit logging system is enabled and operational
User has access to view audit logs

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance management page
steps.expectedResult: List of manual attendance entries is displayed with edit options

steps.action: Note the current details of a specific manual attendance entry (employee ID, date, original time, reason)
steps.expectedResult: Original entry details are visible and documented

steps.action: Click Edit button for the selected entry
steps.expectedResult: Edit form is displayed with current attendance details pre-populated

steps.action: Modify the time field to a different valid time (e.g., change from 09:00 AM to 09:45 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Updated time is displayed in the time field

steps.action: Modify the reason field (e.g., 'Time correction based on manager approval')
steps.expectedResult: Updated reason is displayed in the reason field

steps.action: Click Submit or Update button
steps.expectedResult: Entry is updated successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to audit logs section or audit trail viewer
steps.expectedResult: Audit logs interface is displayed with search and filter options

steps.action: Search for audit records related to the edited manual attendance entry using entry ID or employee ID and date
steps.expectedResult: Audit log entry for the edit action is displayed

steps.action: Verify audit log contains the following details: action type (UPDATE/EDIT), user who made the change (HR officer username), timestamp of the change, entry ID, old values (original time and reason), new values (updated time and reason)
steps.expectedResult: Audit log record displays all required information accurately including: Action: 'EDIT' or 'UPDATE', User: logged-in HR officer's username or ID, Timestamp: exact date and time of the edit, Entry ID: unique identifier of the edited entry, Old Values: original time and reason, New Values: updated time and reason

steps.action: Verify the timestamp in the audit log matches the time when the edit was performed
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is accurate and reflects the actual time of the edit operation

steps.action: Verify that the audit log entry is immutable and cannot be edited or deleted
steps.expectedResult: No edit or delete options are available for audit log entries, ensuring audit trail integrity

postconditions: Manual attendance entry is updated with new values in the database
Audit log contains complete and accurate record of the edit operation
Audit log includes user details (HR officer who made the change) and precise timestamp
Audit log preserves both old and new values for traceability
Audit trail remains immutable and tamper-proof

storyTitle: As HR Officer, I want to delete manual attendance entries to remove incorrect or obsolete records

testCases.title: Validate successful deletion of manual attendance entry
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
At least one manual attendance entry exists in the system
User has delete permissions for manual attendance entries
Manual attendance management page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance management page
steps.expectedResult: List of manual entries is displayed with employee names, dates, times, and action buttons

steps.action: Select an entry and initiate deletion by clicking the delete button
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog is displayed with message asking 'Are you sure you want to delete this attendance entry?' and showing entry details

steps.action: Confirm deletion by clicking 'Yes' or 'Confirm' button
steps.expectedResult: Entry is deleted from the list and confirmation message 'Attendance entry deleted successfully' is displayed

steps.action: Refresh the manual attendance management page
steps.expectedResult: Deleted entry no longer appears in the list of manual attendance entries

steps.action: Wait 5 minutes and check the attendance reports
steps.expectedResult: Deleted entry is removed from all relevant attendance reports

postconditions: Manual attendance entry is permanently deleted from the database
Deletion is logged in the audit trail
Attendance reports reflect the deletion within 5 minutes
User remains on the manual attendance management page

testCases.title: Ensure audit logging of manual attendance deletions
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
At least one manual attendance entry exists in the system
Audit logging system is enabled and functioning
User has access to audit logs or can verify through admin

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance management page and select an entry to delete
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance entry is selected and delete option is available

steps.action: Delete a manual attendance entry by confirming the deletion dialog
steps.expectedResult: Entry is deleted successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to audit log interface or access audit log database
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads successfully showing recent activities

steps.action: Search for the deletion event in the audit logs using the deleted entry details or timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Audit log records deletion with user identity (HR officer name/ID), exact timestamp, operation type (DELETE), and details of the deleted entry (employee ID, date, time)

steps.action: Verify all required fields are present in the audit log entry
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains: user ID, username, timestamp, action type (DELETE), affected employee ID, attendance date, attendance time, and previous entry values

postconditions: Audit log entry is permanently stored in the audit database
Audit log is available for compliance reporting
Deletion event is traceable with complete details

testCases.title: Verify deletion authorization
preconditions: User is logged in as an unauthorized user (non-HR officer or user without delete permissions)
At least one manual attendance entry exists in the system
Authorization and role-based access control is properly configured

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance management page as unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Either page access is denied or delete buttons are not visible/disabled for manual entries

steps.action: Attempt to access delete functionality through UI or direct API call (DELETE /api/attendance/manual/{id})
steps.expectedResult: Deletion is blocked and access denied message is displayed with text like 'You do not have permission to delete attendance entries' or HTTP 403 Forbidden error

steps.action: Verify the manual attendance entry still exists in the system
steps.expectedResult: Entry remains unchanged and is still visible in the manual attendance list

steps.action: Check audit logs for the unauthorized deletion attempt
steps.expectedResult: Audit log records the failed deletion attempt with user identity and timestamp

postconditions: Manual attendance entry remains intact and undeleted
Unauthorized access attempt is logged
System security is maintained
No data integrity issues occur

testCases.title: System prevents deletion of biometric attendance records
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
At least one biometric attendance entry exists in the system
Biometric and manual attendance entries are distinguishable in the system

steps.action: Navigate to attendance management page showing both manual and biometric entries
steps.expectedResult: Attendance entries are displayed with clear indication of entry type (manual vs biometric)

steps.action: Attempt to select a biometric attendance entry for deletion
steps.expectedResult: Delete button is either not visible, disabled, or grayed out for biometric entries

steps.action: If delete option is visible, click on delete for biometric entry
steps.expectedResult: System displays error message 'Biometric attendance records cannot be deleted' or similar prevention message

steps.action: Attempt direct API call to delete biometric entry (DELETE /api/attendance/manual/{biometric_id})
steps.expectedResult: API returns error response (HTTP 400 or 403) with message indicating biometric records cannot be deleted

steps.action: Verify the biometric attendance entry still exists
steps.expectedResult: Biometric entry remains unchanged in the system

postconditions: Biometric attendance record remains intact
System maintains data integrity for biometric records
Prevention attempt may be logged in audit trail

storyTitle: As HR Officer, I want to generate audit logs for manual attendance changes to achieve compliance and traceability

testCases.title: Validate audit logging of manual attendance additions
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized HR officer
Manual attendance management system is accessible
Audit logging system is enabled and functioning
User has permissions to add manual attendance entries

steps.action: Navigate to manual attendance management page and click 'Add New Entry' button
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance entry form is displayed with fields for employee, date, time, and reason

steps.action: Add a manual attendance entry by filling in employee name, date, check-in time, check-out time, and reason, then submit
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance entry is created successfully and confirmation message 'Attendance entry added successfully' is displayed

steps.action: Note the exact timestamp of the addition operation
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded for verification purposes

steps.action: Navigate to audit log interface (GET /api/audit/manual-attendance)
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads showing list of recent manual attendance operations

steps.action: Retrieve audit logs and search for the newly added entry
steps.expectedResult: Audit log records the addition with user identity (HR officer name/ID), timestamp matching the operation time, operation type (CREATE/ADD), employee ID, date, times, and reason

steps.action: Verify all required audit fields are present and accurate
steps.expectedResult: New addition entry appears in audit logs with complete details: user ID, username, timestamp, action type, affected employee, attendance date, check-in time, check-out time, and reason for manual entry

postconditions: Manual attendance entry exists in the system
Audit log entry is permanently stored
Audit trail is complete and traceable
Compliance requirements are met

testCases.title: Verify audit log filtering and export
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized compliance officer or HR officer with audit log access
Multiple audit log entries exist in the system with different users and dates
Audit log interface is accessible

steps.action: Apply additional filter by selecting a date range (e.g., last 7 days)

steps.action: Verify the filtered results show correct data matching the filter criteria
steps.expectedResult: All displayed entries match the selected user and fall within the specified date range

steps.expectedResult: CSV file download is initiated

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file and verify its contents

steps.action: Verify CSV formatting and data integrity

postconditions: Audit logs remain unchanged in the system
CSV file is saved to user's download folder
Filters can be cleared or modified for new searches
Export is available for compliance reporting

testCases.title: Ensure audit logs are available within 1 minute

Manual attendance entry exists that can be edited
Audit logging system is functioning
System time is synchronized and accurate
User has access to audit log interface

steps.action: Note the current system time before performing the operation
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded (e.g., 10:30:00 AM)

steps.expectedResult: Changes are saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed with exact timestamp of the edit

steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads successfully

steps.action: Refresh audit logs and search for the edit operation performed

testCases.title: Validate audit logging of manual attendance edits and deletions

storyTitle: As HR Officer, I want to validate manual attendance inputs to prevent data entry errors and ensure data quality

testCases.title: Validate mandatory field enforcement
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Officer with manual attendance entry permissions
Manual attendance entry form is accessible
At least one employee exists in the system
Database is operational and accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the manual attendance entry section from the HR dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Manual attendance entry form is displayed with all mandatory fields clearly marked (Employee ID, Date, Time)

steps.action: Leave Employee ID field empty and attempt to submit the form
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked and error message 'Employee ID is required' is displayed near the Employee ID field

steps.action: Enter valid Employee ID, leave Date field empty, and attempt to submit the form
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked and error message 'Date is required' is displayed near the Date field

steps.action: Enter valid Employee ID and Date, leave Time field empty, and attempt to submit the form
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked and error message 'Time is required' is displayed near the Time field

steps.action: Fill all mandatory fields (Employee ID, Date, Time) with valid data and click Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully, success confirmation message is displayed, and the new attendance entry appears in the attendance records

postconditions: Valid attendance entry is saved in the database
Form is cleared or redirected to attendance list view
Audit log records the manual attendance entry creation

testCases.title: Verify real-time validation feedback
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Officer with manual attendance entry permissions
Manual attendance entry form is open and displayed
Real-time validation is enabled on the form
Network latency is normal (under 1 second response time)

steps.action: Click on the Date field and enter an invalid date format (e.g., '32/13/2023' or 'abc123')
steps.expectedResult: Error message 'Invalid date format' is displayed immediately (within 1 second) below or near the Date field in red text

steps.action: Clear the Date field and enter a valid date format (e.g., 'DD/MM/YYYY' or system-accepted format like '15/06/2023')
steps.expectedResult: Error message 'Invalid date format' disappears immediately and the field is marked as valid with a green indicator or checkmark

steps.action: Click on the Time field and enter an invalid time format (e.g., '25:70' or 'invalid')
steps.expectedResult: Error message 'Invalid time format' is displayed immediately (within 1 second) below or near the Time field

steps.action: Clear the Time field and enter a valid time format (e.g., 'HH:MM' format like '09:30')
steps.expectedResult: Error message 'Invalid time format' disappears immediately and the field is marked as valid

postconditions: All validation messages are cleared for valid inputs
Form is ready for submission with valid data
No data is saved to the database during validation testing

testCases.title: Ensure duplicate entry prevention
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Officer with manual attendance entry permissions
Manual attendance entry form is accessible
An existing manual attendance record exists in the database (e.g., Employee ID: EMP001, Date: 15/06/2023, Time: 09:00)
Database contains at least one attendance entry for testing duplicate detection

steps.action: Open the manual attendance entry form
steps.expectedResult: Form is displayed with empty fields ready for data entry

steps.action: Enter Employee ID that matches an existing record (e.g., 'EMP001')
steps.expectedResult: Employee ID is accepted and field shows valid state

steps.action: Enter Date that matches the existing record (e.g., '15/06/2023')
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and field shows valid state

steps.action: Enter Time that matches the existing record (e.g., '09:00')
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted and field shows valid state

steps.action: Click Submit button to attempt submission of the duplicate attendance entry
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked, error message 'Duplicate attendance entry detected. An attendance record for this employee on this date and time already exists' is displayed prominently, and the form remains on the entry page without saving

steps.action: Modify the Time field to a different value (e.g., '10:00') and click Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted successfully as the entry is no longer a duplicate, success message is displayed, and the new attendance record is saved

postconditions: No duplicate attendance entries exist in the database
Original attendance record remains unchanged
New non-duplicate entry is successfully saved
Audit log shows the duplicate prevention action and successful submission
